semantic_title: Codes That Contain Multiple Clinical Concepts POA Assignment
section_path: Present on Admission Guidelines > Assigning the POA Indicator > Codes That Contain Multiple Clinical Concepts

content.full_text: Assign 'N' if at least one of the clinical concepts included in the code was not present on admission (e.g., COPD with acute exacerbation and the exacerbation was not present on admission; gastric ulcer that does not start bleeding until after admission; asthma patient develops status asthmaticus after admission). Assign 'Y' if all of the clinical concepts included in the code were present on admission (e.g., duodenal ulcer that perforates prior to admission). For infection codes that include the causal organism, assign 'Y' if the infection (or signs of the infection) were present on admission, even though the culture results may not be known until after admission (e.g., patient is admitted with pneumonia and the provider documents Pseudomonas as the causal organism a few days later). (Evidence: pg no: 119, L51-L57, pg no: 120, L60-L61)
content.summary: For codes with multiple clinical concepts, assign N if any concept was not present at admission, Y if all concepts were present at admission (Evidence: pg no: 119, L51-L57, pg no: 120, L60-L61)
key_concepts: Multiple clinical concepts in single code (Evidence: pg no: 119, L51)
At least one concept not present (Evidence: pg no: 119, L52)
All concepts present (Evidence: pg no: 119, L54)
Infection codes with organisms (Evidence: pg no: 119, L56, pg no: 120, L60-L61)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign N if at least one clinical concept was not present on admission (Evidence: pg no: 119, L52)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a code contains multiple clinical concepts and any one of those concepts was not present at admission, assign N indicator (Evidence: pg no: 119, L51-L53)
common_applications: COPD with acute exacerbation where exacerbation developed after admission
Gastric ulcer with bleeding where bleeding started after admission

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign Y if all clinical concepts were present on admission (Evidence: pg no: 119, L54)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a code contains multiple clinical concepts and all concepts were present at admission, assign Y indicator (Evidence: pg no: 119, L54-L55)
common_applications: Duodenal ulcer that perforates prior to admission
All components of combination code present at admission

detailed_rules.rule_text: For infection codes with organisms, assign Y if infection was present at admission regardless of culture timing (Evidence: pg no: 119, L56-L57, pg no: 120, L60-L61)
detailed_rules.explanation: Infection codes that include causal organisms should receive Y if the infection or signs of infection were present at admission, even if culture results came later (Evidence: pg no: 119, L56-L57, pg no: 120, L60-L61)
common_applications: Pneumonia with specific organism identified post-admission
UTI with organism cultured after admission

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify all clinical concepts in the code
Step 2: Determine POA status for each concept
Step 3: If any concept not present at admission, assign N
Step 4: If all concepts present at admission, assign Y
Step 5: For infections, focus on infection presence, not organism identification timing

referenced_by.title: Chronic Conditions with Acute Exacerbation
referenced_by.explanation: Chronic conditions with exacerbations reference this guideline

coding_scenarios.scenario: COPD patient develops acute exacerbation after admission
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient with COPD admitted for routine care, develops acute exacerbation on day 2
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify COPD (chronic) and exacerbation (acute) concepts
Step 2: COPD was present at admission, exacerbation was not
Step 3: Since one concept not present at admission, assign N

correct_coding.primary_code: COPD with acute exacerbation with N indicator
correct_coding.rationale: Exacerbation component was not present on admission (Evidence: pg no: 119, L52-L53)

incorrect_coding.code: COPD with acute exacerbation with Y indicator
incorrect_coding.rationale: Should assign N when any component not present at admission

coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient admitted with pneumonia, Pseudomonas identified by culture on day 3
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify pneumonia was present at admission
Step 2: Note organism identified later by culture
Step 3: Assign Y because infection was present at admission

correct_coding.primary_code: Pneumonia due to Pseudomonas with Y indicator
correct_coding.rationale: Infection was present at admission despite later organism identification (Evidence: pg no: 119, L56-L57, pg no: 120, L60-L61)

incorrect_coding.code: Pneumonia due to Pseudomonas with N indicator
incorrect_coding.rationale: Should assign Y when infection present at admission
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Focusing on organism identification timing rather than infection presence

breakdown.COPD: Chronic condition present at admission (Evidence: pg no: 119, L53)
breakdown.acute_exacerbation: Developed after admission (Evidence: pg no: 119, L53)

examples.rationale: Assign N because exacerbation was not present on admission (Evidence: pg no: 119, L52-L53)

breakdown.pneumonia: Present at admission (Evidence: pg no: 120, L60-L61)
breakdown.Pseudomonas: Identified by culture after admission (Evidence: pg no: 120, L60-L61)

examples.rationale: Assign Y because infection was present at admission (Evidence: pg no: 119, L56-L57, pg no: 120, L60-L61)

warnings: Must evaluate each clinical concept separately (Evidence: pg no: 119, L51-L55)
For infections, focus on infection presence, not organism timing (Evidence: pg no: 119, L56-L57, pg no: 120, L60-L61)
best_practices: Break down combination codes into component concepts (Evidence: pg no: 119, L51-L55)
Consider infection signs present at admission for organism codes (Evidence: pg no: 119, L56-L57, pg no: 120, L60-L61)
common_mistakes: Not evaluating all components of combination codes (Evidence: pg no: 119, L51-L55)
Focusing on culture timing rather than infection presence (Evidence: pg no: 119, L56-L57, pg no: 120, L60-L61)
tips: List all clinical concepts in the code before assigning POA (Evidence: pg no: 119, L51-L55)
Remember culture results don't determine infection POA status (Evidence: pg no: 119, L56-L57, pg no: 120, L60-L61)
implementation_notes: Train coders to identify all components of combination codes
clinical_context: Many ICD-10-CM codes combine multiple clinical concepts
